message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "Using the World Bank Enterprise Surveys and the Global Findex dataset, we explore the relationship between financial inclusion and firm performance in Sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys", "Global Findex dataset"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "This paper analyzes the impact of natural disasters on GDP growth using a panel data with information on more than 135 countries for the period 1985-2017 from the EM-DAT database.", "dataset": ["panel data with information on more than 135 countries for the period 1985-2017 from the EM-DAT database"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "We combine data from the Humanitarian Data Exchange (HDX), representing the intensity of armed conflicts, and spatially disaggregated crop yield statistics from the Global Agro-climatic Zones dataset to assess the impact of conflict on agricultural productivity.", "dataset": ["Humanitarian Data Exchange (HDX)", "Global Agro-climatic Zones dataset"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Fragility, Conflict, and Violence"]}, {"sentence": "This article examines the energy transition in Ethiopia by utilizing the Renewable Energy Policy Network for the 21st Century (REN21) database and analyzing household survey data collected by the Central Statistical Agency.", "dataset": ["Renewable Energy Policy Network for the 21st Century (REN21) database", "household survey data collected by the Central Statistical Agency"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We use data from the Global Fund and documents from the World Health Organization to analyze the effects of funding mechanisms on tuberculosis control programs in low-income settings.", "dataset": ["Global Fund"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This research investigates the relationship between access to water and household living standards in sub-Saharan Africa, using data from the Multiple Indicator Cluster Survey and the Demographic and Health Survey.", "dataset": ["Multiple Indicator Cluster Survey", "Demographic and Health Survey"], "topic": ["Water", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "We assess the impacts of various structural reforms on productivity growth in Europe using firm-level data from the Orbis dataset and country-level governance data from the Worldwide Governance Indicators.", "dataset": ["Orbis dataset", "Worldwide Governance Indicators"], "topic": ["Governance", "Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "To investigate the determinants of migration flows in Latin America, we combine population censuses data from several countries and geo-referenced information on environmental conditions and social amenities variables from public sources such as LandScan Global and the Natural Earth dataset.", "dataset": ["population censuses data from several countries", "LandScan Global", "Natural Earth dataset"], "topic": ["Migration", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "In order to explore the dynamics of gender equity in wage determination across Brazilian regions, we make use of the National Household Survey and the Wage Scope database.", "dataset": ["National Household Survey", "Wage Scope database"], "topic": ["Gender", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "This study analyzes how natural resource extraction affects the income of local communities in Indonesia by exploiting oil and gas concession datasets along with community-level socio-economic data from the Village Census.", "dataset": ["oil and gas concession datasets", "Village Census"], "topic": ["Extractive Industries", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}]

content: [{"sentence": "Using the World Bank Enterprise Surveys and the Global Findex dataset, we explore the relationship between financial inclusion and firm performance in Sub-Saharan Africa.",
